mdRecord.dcterms:description: East and center sections by Mills, 1836-1842. West wing by Walters, 1851. 1853 Ammi B. Young named supervising architect, merged Mills and Walters designs with added south wing. South wing construction 1855-1858. West wing construction 1855-1864. Construction of North wing supervised by Alfred Bult Mullett, 1867-1870. East wing facade renovated 1907-1910 by James Knox Taylor. Renovation, remodeling and restoration projects completed 1950s-2007. â€” https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/301/web%20version%20Architectural%20History%20Treasury%20Building_0.pdf [work]
